title: What is the significance of the eye in different cultures and practices and how is it used in hypnosis and initiation techniques?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, references to various cultures and traditions have been made regarding the symbolism of the sun and its connection to the concept of the "eye." It is said that in ancient Egyptian mythology, the sun and the moon were the eyes of the god Hor-jerti, connected to two serpents, similar to the Kundalini tradition in India. The author also mentions the importance of the two hemispheres, a concept explored by the School of Fascination by Virgilio T. and the techniques for inducing hypnosis utilized by Abate Faria, Jerry Kein, and French hypnotists. In this final part, Rupert Sheldrake's book "The Sense of Being Stared At" is cited, and interesting experiments are mentioned where people react to being looked at even when the viewer is behind them.
